module.title: quantity words
faclan uiread
module.p: Quantity words are words which help to describe quantities of a substance or aggregate. In other words, quantity words introduce responses to the following kinds of question –

ul.li: Cia mheud fìona a dh’òl Raonaid? How much wine did Rachel drink?
Cia mheud chon a tha aig Màiri? How many dogs does Mary have?

module.p: The main kinds of quantity words are –

ul.li:
the numerals – aon one, dà two, trì three, ceithir four, ..., deich ten
Tha sia coin aig Màiri. Mary has six dogs.

the numeric quantity nouns – dusan dozen, twelve, fichead score, twenty, ceud hundred, etc.
Tha fichead cù aig Màiri. Mary has twenty dogs.

the generic quantity nouns – mòran many, a lot, barrachd more, cus too much/many, etc.
Dh’òl Raonaid mòran fìona. Rachel drank a lot of wine.
Tha mòran chon aig Màiri. Mary has a lot of dogs.

the measure nouns – botal bottle, clach stone, etc.
Dh’òl Raonaid botal fìona. Rachel drank a bottle of wine.
